data.title: Some renaming from "folder" to "package"
data.body: Do some renaming in preparation for an `IPackageLoader`, which will bring packages on par with sprites and sound files, and let us move all those out of the engine.

data.title: Map download bug - Spectators kicked out as game starts

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Recently there have been a bug : 
When you click "Install map" from lobby, tick ready, and game starts, then you get kicked out when the game starts.

You have to install the map, exit the lobby, then enter again, to avoid being kicked.

I dunno if happens on all maps / everytime, but happening to a lot of players recently.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29783086-map-download-bug-spectators-kicked-out-as-game-starts?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Abort 1v1 games, when opponent crashes at start
data.body:
I just played a game for 5 mins ... only to realize that I was playing alone, as my opponent crashed at start :) 

The victory menu should be shown and the game stopped.

data.title: (Duplicate of #10223) Chase units outside its vision in "fog of war"
data.body:
See #10223

When a unit leaves a chasing units vision in a chase it should follow in that direction for 10 cells not knowing where the unit is but assuming a strait direction for 10 or so cells and continue following if it pops back in to view.

data.title: AI in Red Alert does not use landing boats
data.body:
I absolutely love navy battles on island maps and amphibious landings that come with these.
However, it seems the AI is incable of using landing boats to try to invate other islands (same thing is true for transport helicopters btw).
This is probably VERY difficult to implement but I wanted to suggest it anyway, as I feel it would add a lot of depth to the gameplay on island maps!

data.title: Fixed crashes with Red Alert 2 wav files
data.body: The recent changes made the https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2 mod unplayable. Even clicking a button crashes the whole game. This reverts parts of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/5063e56786c7aa47dda640df6a8acf3d6a941c3a to aid debugging. I stumbled upon some `if (Format != "WAVE")` cases with `Format = "fmt"` so this rejected valid *.wav files without reason. ~~It won't fix it completely though. Something else is still bogus.~~ The generic exceptions "not a valid sound file" are far from useful so I put it into the appropriate log files.

data.title: AA guns can't shoot at aircraft outside the map
data.body: So I was just playing a 1v1 on singles and noticed that if I kept my aircraft at the very top of the map and moved them to engage a nuclear silo also placed at the top of the map the AA guns defending it couldn't hit my yaks because they'd move outside of the map.

data.title: Translation support
data.body:
Prerequisites for initial translations:
- [ ] Engine support:
  - [x] Translation support for yaml-defined strings. [#3929]
  - [ ] Translation support for code-defined strings.
  - [ ] Change server messages to send a string ID and arguments to translate client-side.
- [ ] Tooling:
  - [x] Automated chrome string extraction. [#5152]
  - [ ] Automated format string sanity checks (verify that strings with formatting parameters define the same number across all translations).
  - [ ] Utility command for showing missing translation strings.
- [ ] Extract hardcoded strings into english translation.
- [ ] Extract yaml strings into english translation. (after the hardcoded strings)
- [ ] Include language setting in crash logs.

Later improvements:
- [x] Support for detecting/downloading/installing foreign content bundles (sound/art).  Related to the ongoing mod browser / installation work. [#11375 and followups]
- [ ] Support for switching art/sounds based on translation.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29755626-translation-support?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Menu shown in screenshot even if not used in-game
data.body:
The image show the menu in the screenshot even if I did not open it in-game. Windows 7 and the "Print Screen" button is pressed and opened in paint.
![menu show in screen capture even if not in-game](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/12224510/2abcc782-b7f3-11e5-89ed-f387c9a40ff1.png)

data.title: Long country names will overlap the server status field.
data.body:
I originally decided not to use `WidgetUtils.TruncateText` because I assumed that I had given enough room for all the country names.  The GeoIP country database disagrees.

![screen shot 2016-01-10 at 19 39 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/12223519/fa280c10-b7d1-11e5-8bbe-c4c95a7f230f.png)

data.title: Fixed the Dune 2000 legacy map import
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10387 and also adds a lint test so it won't happen again. Spotted another one with it: `palacec`.

data.title: Persistent waypoint paths.
data.body:
I saw in the TS sneak peek video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yrt_m-xwbok) the icon of the "waypoint" mode, will be implemented in the TS mod, won't it ?

I was wondering if this would be transferrable to RA. 

I know you can do this with Shift+clicks to draw a route. 
However, drawing a "waypoints route" once and for all would be really awesome, as it would help : 
- having them visually, and be sure I didn't forget Shift while clicking (messes up the whole thing)
- setting predefined routes (to avoid something for instance, or to sneak)
- using again the same route at different times, if old army destroyed
- and most importantly ^_^ setting infinite patrol loops
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29738098-persistent-waypoint-paths?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add Frames: support to Combined sub-sequences
data.body:
MechCommander sprites use one .shp file for each facing, so using `Combine` is a must.

However, probably to save memory or at least HDD space, they usually only cover half of the facing 'clock' and require considerable amounts of flipping and reverse-playing.
FlipX/Y are supported on `Combine`d sub-sequences, but `Frames` and `Reverse` are not. It would be extremely useful (and for some animations even necessary) to add at least `Frames` support to `Combine`d sub-sequences, to make move animations for turrets and barrels easier to implement.

Basically, I'd like our code to support something like this: 
https://gist.github.com/reaperrr/63900af4afe9a560e762
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29737614-add-frames-support-to-combined-sub-sequences?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix shroud not updating when disabled
data.body:
If you disable visibility checks using the debug options, the affected areas of the shroud are not refreshed.

This can be most easily seen during a replay if you spectate a player who used this option, as your view of the shroud remains outdated until units move through it.

![](http://imgur.com/sEfyiEY.png)

Suggested changelog: Fix shroud not updating when "Disable Visibility Checks" is used.

data.title: Fix paradroping infantry being spawned at 0,0
data.body:
Infantry no longer spawn at 0,0 when a paradrop LZ cell is blocked

Fixes #10396

data.title: Watching replays on different speeds affects superweapon timers
data.body:
On release, RA mod.

If you toggle a replay between the different speeds the timer in the top corner is affected.

![timer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/12218411/6c434678-b716-11e5-9bef-cc2c039fe62d.jpg)
Here it says 0:19 seconds remaining when the actual time is closer to 7 minutes when viewing a replay on max speed.

data.title: Fix dates for upgrade rules
data.body:
This fixes the wrong date from #9808, and also updates several dates from PRs that were merged between playtest-20151031 and release-20151224.

The dates for the following two upgrade rules have not been touched since they were backported to release-20151224:
1. 20151107: PaticleSize -> ParticleSize
2. 20151122: DeployToUpgrade, Upgrades -> DeployedUpgrades

Fixes #10463.

data.title: Add a way to tag actors via the Lua API
data.body:
Scenario: I spawn a bunch of crates and do not store them in a variable. Then I use `Map.ActorsInBox` to destroy some actors including these spawned crates. My simplified function:

``` lua
function ClearMap()
  local unitsToDestroy =
    Map.ActorsInBox(Map.TopLeft,Map.BottomRight, function(actor)
      return IsHusk(actor) or actor.Owner ~= neutral or actor.HasProperty('Crate')
    end)

  Utils.Do(unitsToDestroy, function(actor)
   -- destroy...
  end)
end
```

As you can see the `actor.HasProperty('Crate')` part is not going to work because there's no such property. It would be rather handy to tag actors, so I could query them directly, without storing them in variables.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29732772-add-a-way-to-tag-actors-via-the-lua-api?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Upgrade rule date for recent cloak changes is wrong
Prevent items without size from being added to SpatiallyPartitioned.
data.body:
Items with no size act unexpectedly as they can fail to be returned when querying partition bins as they do not intersect along the top or left edges of the bin. We prevent such items being added in the first place to avoid this scenario.

Example:

``` c#
new Rectangle(0, 0, 0, 0).IntersectsWith(new Rectangle(0, 0, 2, 2));
false

new Rectangle(0, 0, 1, 1).IntersectsWith(new Rectangle(0, 0, 2, 2));
true
```

As a side effect - we must now prevent any Immobile items that do not have size from being added to the screen map.

data.title: Calculate better upper bounds in SpatiallyPartitioned.
data.body:
SpatiallyPartitioned was calculating larger that necessary bounding regions as this was simple to do and does not impact correctness. By being careful to calculate the upper bounds exactly we can avoid checking more bins than we need to during updates and queries.

To help avoid regressions, I have included a series of tests.
